32.title: Add initial Quickstart templates
32.body: Scaffold out the first ~20 quickstart templates, most of which have content and are ready to go.  More to follow soon.
32.Author: jlorich

Commits.commit_message:
reorganize, add scaffold folder

update readmes

clean up tf provider

add readme and initial templates

add initial pass at readmes

more readme updates

update various quickstarts

finish cleaning up 101s

more updates

lots fo template updates

add remaining

more updates

Issue_Comments.comment_body: Thank you Joey! This is fantastic!!

53.title: Add quickstart sample for AKS private cluster with custom DNS
53.body: Add a quick-start sample for AKS private cluster with custom DNS.
53.Author: feiskyer

Commits.commit_message: Add quickstart sample for private AKS cluster with custom DNS

Issue_Comments.comment_body: @grayzu could you help to have a look again?

@feiskyer thanks. this works as expected except when there is an error with the cluster provisioning. When this is run via Azure devops for instance and there is an error with the AKS resource (say the resource already exists), I would want the wait for resource group to timeout and display the aks failure error but the the wait for resource group keeps running till you cancel the release. I'm experimenting with the timeout but havent gotten this to work as desired. Any recommendations?
@dejiaja what errors have you got when you said "an error with AKS resource"?

473847880.comment_body: Mostly looks great. One question regarding the script. It would be great if this could be done without the script and just use native providers.

File_Comments.comment: Why are you using such an old version of the provider? This is not even the latests 1.X version. Ideally this should be using the latest 2.x provider to take advantage of the newest APIs.

Since you are using the new syntax for variables, you need to have a terraform block that specifies the required_version greater than 0.11: https://www.terraform.io/docs/language/settings/index.html#specifying-a-required-terraform-version

I didn't know what this should look like, so I copied an existing file in this repo.
Anyway, update is in...

What I meant by my previous comment was that this block should include this property to ensure that the right version of Terraform is being used and can correctly interpret the var.blah syntax:

required_version = ">=0.12"

If you have tested using 1.0, you should require that version instead of 0.12.

These changes are good as well.

Issue_Comments.comment_body: Thanks @vhorne !!

723637142.comment_body:
Thanks for the PR!

This looks great and will be a valuable addition to the Terraform quickstarts. I have made a couple of minor suggested changes. Please update and I will merge.

723741117.comment_body:
Clarifying my previous ask. Apologies for my initial vague request.

Should be a quick change and then we can get this merged.

Thanks again for the PR, btw!!

Issue_Comments.comment_body: Thanks @vhorne !!

66.title: Move documentation sample code to GitHub
66.Author: TomArcherMsft

Commits.commit_message: Changed folder to match convention, added sample to top-level readme
Added ip address to output to aid in customer verifying results of example
Updated code for two VMSS articles
Updated code for two VMSS articles - 2
Fixed DNA naming for VMSS and Jumpbox VM
301-hub-spoke - Created and added main.tf and variables.tf files

Issue_Comments.comment_body: #sign-off @grayzu Could you review and merge?

Hey @TomArcherMsft ,

This is a huge PR and I will have a more detailed look before merging but after a quick glance, one thing that I noticed is that we need to add the`required_version` property to the terraform blocks. This will ensure that users are using a version of Terraform that supports the new syntax that is used in these examples. 

If you have been testing these with Terraform version 1.0, I would suggest setting this to `required_version = ">=1.0". If you are using a previous version, I would use that version instead.

Thanks.

68.title: Added two Azure ML quickstart templates
68.body: Added two Azure ML quickstart templates for workspace creation @grayzu
68.Author: denniseik

Commits.commit_message: Added two Azure ML quickstart templates

Removing git ignore from PR

Git ignore should not be include in the PR.
Merge branch 'feature/azureml-workspace' of https://github.com/denniseik/terraform into feature/azureml-workspace
update resource abbrevations to azure standarsd

File_Comments.comment:
To align with [Azure naming recommendations](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cloud-adoption-framework/ready/azure-best-practices/resource-abbreviations), this should be 
``` terraform
    name         = "rg-${var.name}-${var.environment}"
```

variables that are not concatenated do not need the string interpolation.
``` terraform
   location      = var.location
```
Thanks!

733178736.comment_body:
Thank you, Dennis, for the PR!!!

Overall this looks fantastic. With a few minor naming tweaks and syntax things, this will be good to go.

73.title: Including Azure ML compute with existing examples. Adding network-isolated examples.
73.body:
With this PR we bring multiple changes to the Azure Machine Learning examples:

- We add compute and bug fixes to the 101 example
- We introduce compute to the 201 examples
- We add a brownfield 202 example
73.Author: denniseik

removed network rules to allow for dataset creation

Added Compute Instance and Compute Cluster Resources

updating 201 AML

updating notebooks Private DNS Zone

updating firewall on ACR
Add readme links and variable descriptions

Adding 202 for existing VNet
include compute resources and network dependencies

Add compute, private link dependencies and updated readme's for publication
remove gitignore before tf repo merge
adding resource dependency to compute instance
updating aks subnetvar default to larger cidr

Ml updates
Include variable defaults in read me

Merge pull request #10 from denniseik/ryhud

Ryhud
use data construct to reference existing resources

Issue_Comments.comment_body: @grayzu @dapolloxp @ryhud @djr1991
@grayzu Ping on this one, as we'd like to get our docs published after merging these pieces
Thanks @grayzu ! Tagging @ryhud @dapolloxp as well to look a the feedback.

@denniseik I am going to go ahead and merge this as the code looks good. I would suggest updating the `quickstart/202-machine-learning-moderately-secure-existing-VNet/readme.md` to show all of the required variables but will leave that up to you.
Thanks @grayzu !

766119344.comment_body:
Overall these changes look fantastic! Thank you for the contribution!!

In addition to the individual comments that I have made inline, please run the following command from each of your quickstart directories to format the *.tf files correctly / consistently:

```bash
terraform fmt
```

Commits.commit_message: Removed code fencing from code file
Added randomness of rg name, links to ref docs

File_Comments.comment:
Might be more user friendly to use `random_pet` resource here instead of GUID. This would also allow us to include the prefix here so that there is no need to do the string concatenation below. example:
``` terraform
resource "random_pet" "rg-name" {
    prefix           = var.resource_group_name_prefix
}
```

Also, you should include the random provider in the `random_providers` block above.

Issue_Comments.comment_body: @grayzu Mark, this is ready for your review. #sign-off

76.title: Add 101-azure-virtual-desktop
76.body: Examples files to deploy Azure Virtual Desktop with the supporting Azure services needed such as network, storage, VM, compute gallery, RBAC, log analytics.
76.Author: jensheerin

Commits.commit_message: new folder for anf option, edits to variables
Merge branch 'AVD' of https://github.com/jensheerin/terraform into AVD

Issue_Comments.comment_body: #sign-off

873494753.comment_body:
Overall, this looks really good! 

In general, this seems like more detailed and complex than a typical 101 level quickstart since it contains monitoring, etc. I will leave it up to you if this really is a basic (101) example but will support you changing it to a 201 instead. Your call as you are the VD experts.

I have made a few comments / questions. Once they are addresses, this should be good to go. 

Thanks for submitting the PR, btw!!

882014158.comment_body:
Thanks for getting the changes it. It looks great.

Although, it would be good to have more comments in the *.tf files, especially if this is going to be included in our docs, we can update that later.

File_Comments.comment: Please move the terraform and provider blocks to a providers.tf file.
Should make use of the random_pet resource to abstract names like this. Please refer to this PR for more context: https://github.com/Azure/terraform/pull/81/files

Should use Azure resource naming best practices for the resource names, especially if this is intended to be included in documentation. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cloud-adoption-framework/ready/azure-best-practices/resource-abbreviations
@vhorne please rename this file to providers.tf ( with an "s" on the end) then it will be good to merge.

I'd like to keep the same names used in all the other Quickstarts to be consistent with them.

103.title: Add examples for Azure Disk Encryption Extension for VM and VMSS
103.body:
VM Examples are from https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/pull/15356/files
Adding examples for VMSS as well
103.Author: myc2h6o

Commits.commit_message: Add examples for Azure Disk Encryption Extension

File_Comments.comment:
An idea inspired by [BridgeCrew Checkov](https://www.checkov.io/)'s [policy `CKV_AZURE_112`](https://docs.bridgecrew.io/docs/ensure-that-key-vault-key-is-backed-by-hsm):

>For added assurance, when you use Azure Key Vault, you can import or generate keys in hardware security modules (HSMs) that never leave the HSM boundary. This scenario is often referred to as bring your own key, or BYOK. Azure Key Vault uses nCipher nShield family of HSMs (FIPS 140-2 Level 2 validated) to protect your keys.

Would the `key_type` assign to `RSA-HSM` be better?
The `settings` looks like a json string, would using `jsonencode` function be better here?

Issue_Comments.comment_body:
Hi @grayzu and @lonegunmanb thanks for reviewing the pr! I've resolved the comments from both of you, could you take another look? Update in the change:
- renamed provider.tf to provider**s**.tf
- removed the default value for `name_prefix`
- use `RSA-HSM` for the key vault key
- use `jsonencode` to specify the json settings
LGTM

107.title: User Story 1977015
107.body: Code update as part of [User Story 1977015](https://dev.azure.com/mseng/TechnicalContent/_workitems/edit/1977015)
107.Author: TomArcherMsft

Commits.commit_message: Updating code to align with Contributor Guide template
Updated variables to snake case per review
Ran 'terraform fmt' against code being modified in this PR'
Per review, changed var name from camel case to snake case

File_Comments.comment:
Can we use snake-case here due to the community [convention](https://github.com/terraform-linters/tflint/blob/master/docs/rules/terraform_naming_convention.md) please?

```hcl
resource "random_pet" "rg_name" {
```

Can we run `terraform fmt` command for this directory please? The formatted line should be:

```hcl
prefix = var.resource_group_name_prefix
```

I know this line is irrelevant to this pr but maybe we should consider renaming this resource to `corp_attestation` to follow the [naming convention](https://github.com/terraform-linters/tflint/blob/master/docs/rules/terraform_naming_convention.md)?

Can we use snake-case here due to the community [convention](https://github.com/terraform-linters/tflint/blob/master/docs/rules/terraform_naming_convention.md) please?

```hcl
name      = random_pet.rg_name.id
```

Issue_Comments.comment_body: #sign-off
#sign-off
@lonegunmanb Edits made. Possible to merge this morning (PST) as I have work depending on this work.

File_Comments.comment: Can we remove this blank line please since it'll cause some warnings on some community linters?

Can we run `terraform fmt` command for this directory please? The formatted line should be:

```hcl
source  = "hashicorp/azurerm"

Can we add `random` provider constraint here please? It might look verbose for this built-in provider but it's a best practice to declare all providers' version constraints explicitly to avoid potential inconsistency introduced by different provider's versions.

Since the `azurerm_resource_group.default` has been removed, I guess we should change this line to:

```hcl
location            = azurerm_resource_group.rg.location
```

Since the `azurerm_resource_group.default` has been removed, I guess we should change this line to:

```hcl
resource_group_name = azurerm_resource_group.rg.name
```

Since the `azurerm_resource_group.default` has been removed, I guess we should change this line to:

```hcl
resource_group_name = azurerm_resource_group.rg.name
```

Since the `azurerm_resource_group.default` has been removed, I guess we should change this line to:

```hcl
resource_group_name = azurerm_resource_group.rg.name
```

Same to the next line:

```hcl
location                     = azurerm_resource_group.rg.location
```

We also need change the resource group name we used in `mysql-fs-db.tf` file:

```hcl
// Manages the MySQL Flexible Server Database
resource "azurerm_mysql_flexible_database" "default" {
  name                = "mysqlfsdb_${random_string.name.result}"
  resource_group_name = azurerm_resource_group.rg.name
  server_name         = azurerm_mysql_flexible_server.rg.name # We should rename default to rg here
  charset             = "utf8"
  collation           = "utf8_unicode_ci"
}
```

Since we've used `random` resource here, could we add the following block in `providers.tf` file?

```hcl
random = {
      source = "hashicorp/random"
      version = "~>3.0"
}
```

Since we're using `#` as single line comment for this module, could we change line 10 in `mysql-fs-db.tf` file?

```hcl
 // Manages the MySQL Flexible Server Database
```

to

```hcl
 # Manages the MySQL Flexible Server Database
```

We might add the following line there, otherwise the generated name might start with a number, that will be an invalid admin user name for `azurerm_mysql_flexible_server.default` resource.

```hcl
  numeric  = false
```

Since the `azurerm_resource_group.default` has been removed, I guess we should change this line to:

```hcl
resource_group_name           = azurerm_resource_group.rg.name
```

Since the `azurerm_resource_group.default` has been removed, I guess we should change this line to:

```hcl
resource_group_name  = azurerm_resource_group.rg.name
```

File_Comments.comment: Could we remove this TODO since this code will be rendered as an official document?
I meant it for the developers that will use the official docs, should I move it to the top of the file perhaps?
Yes, putting it at the top of the document would be appropriate.
Why such a big network for this example? Can you use /24 instead?
Same as above, why such a big subnet? could you use /27 instead?
Is this depends on necessary? We generally do not want to add explicit dependencies unless absolutely necessary.
Are these resources required to be completed before this resource can successfully be created? If not, then these explicit dependencies should be removed.

Hi @grayzu , I think create the db after the security group is ready make sense to me, but the question here is we've assigned a network security group without any rule, that will apply a default rule which basically allow all traffics. Should we add some network security rules here?
yes this was random
yes, you need to create this first
yes, if you were gonna do it in the portal you'd first create all this then sql db

@urosran  Why does the subnet need to exist before the route table is created? They should be able to be created in parallel, then the association below waits for both to exist before it connects them.

Ok, I can understand this dependency from a security perspective but to @lonegunmanb 's point, the example should then have some security group rules, correct? Please add appropriate rules for this scenario.
@urosran Please update the Vnet and Subnet examples with smaller networks.

Not in this example, we're trying to follow the portal experience. You don't have to set anything, all defaults have been chosen already by the PMs and the networking team. This is to make it super easy for you to get started. The next code sample will show you how to set all sorts of networking rules.

TL;DR: To even associate a subnet with a route table you need one to exist therefore to make sure that the association will always be made and you won't have some failiure where route table is created but subent isn't you serialize them. This process is a fraction of the total time so we're not worried about it at all.

For more info check the docs https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/manage-route-table
dome
done

We do not like to use explicit depends_on statements unless necessary and in this case, unless I am issing something, it should no be necessary. Terraform creates implicit dependencies based on resource references so the association will create an implicit dependency to both route table and subnet resulting in the association only being made when both of those have completed successfully. See this dependency graph for clarification:
![graph-no-dependson](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2914336/195415685-da00a015-9588-4992-813f-ac44411958a4.svg)

File_Comments.comment:
This hard coded password is not safe since it's too weak and common, could we use a `random_password` resource to generate the `admin_password` and remove this varaible? The following sample should work:

```hcl
resource "random_password" "password" {
  length           = 20
  min_lower    = 1
  min_upper    = 1
  min_numeric = 1
  min_special  = 1
  special          = true
}
```

148.title: 201-aks-rbac-dashboard-admin patch
148.body: This patch fix 201-aks-rbac-dashboard-admin, use identity instead of service principal.
148.Author: lonegunmanb

File_Comments.comment:
I am not familiar with this example. I dont understand why the kubernetes dashboard is not installed. Only this role-binding is created before installing the dashboard. 

The problem is that after running terraform the user would still have to run manually:

```
kubectl apply -f https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubernetes/dashboard/v2.7.0/aio/deploy/recommended.yaml
``` 

But this conflicts with this role binding created via Terraform.

This is what is installed via Terraform

```
% k get clusterrolebinding kubernetes-dashboard -o yaml
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRoleBinding
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: "2023-02-21T09:44:21Z"
  name: kubernetes-dashboard
  resourceVersion: "1564"
  uid: 65eed073-a03b-416b-b802-239b9f540b18
roleRef:
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
  kind: ClusterRole
  name: cluster-admin
subjects:
- kind: ServiceAccount
  name: kubernetes-dashboard
  namespace: kube-system
```

This is what installed by the Dashboard installed:

```
% k get clusterrolebinding kubernetes-dashboard -o yaml
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRoleBinding
metadata:
  annotations:
    kubectl.kubernetes.io/last-applied-configuration: |
      {"apiVersion":"rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1","kind":"ClusterRoleBinding","metadata":{"annotations":{},"name":"kubernetes-dashboard"},"roleRef":{"apiGroup":"rbac.authorization.k8s.io","kind":"ClusterRole","name":"kubernetes-dashboard"},"subjects":[{"kind":"ServiceAccount","name":"kubernetes-dashboard","namespace":"kubernetes-dashboard"}]}
  creationTimestamp: "2023-02-21T10:01:01Z"
  name: kubernetes-dashboard
  resourceVersion: "5563"
  uid: e9b28f41-730a-4ff3-a265-baf6f5733a3e
roleRef:
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
  kind: ClusterRole
  name: kubernetes-dashboard
subjects:
- kind: ServiceAccount
  name: kubernetes-dashboard
  namespace: kubernetes-dashboard
```

Issue_Comments.comment_body:
I think the example should also install the dashboard with the desired configuration. Here the user experience is very bad, because creating the `ClusterRoleBinding` with Terraform the installation of the dashboard fails :( 
This has nothing to do with your PR, it was already broken.

> I think the example should also install the dashboard with the desired configuration. Here the user experience is very bad, because creating the `ClusterRoleBinding` with Terraform the installation of the dashboard fails :( This has nothing to do with your PR, it was already broken.

Thanks @zioproto for your review. I think we can open an issue on the user experience improvement and leave it as another day's job.

File_Comments.comment:
We can add the following code here:

```hcl
resource "random_password" "password" {
  count = var.password == null ? 1 : 0

  length           = 20
  special          = true
  min_numeric = 1
  min_upper = 1
  min_lower = 1
  min_special = 1
}

locals {
  password = try(random_password.password[0].result, var.password)
}
```

Then the password could be:

```hcl
password = local.password
```
Fixed.
Fixed.

File_Comments.comment:
As the password could be generated by `random_password`, we could add an output here:

```hcl
output "password" {
  sensitive = true
  value = local.password
}
```
Fixed.
@TomArcherMsft what is the intent of outputting the password? Marking it as sensitive will write it to the state but will not show it in any logging, etc.

@grayzu Since the password is used as a Windows vm's password and this is a demo, we can assume that our users won't composite this root module with other modules, they just want to apply and then have a try, so this password is essential for them to try this vm.

Another approach is to provision a KeyValut, then store this password as a secret, only the user who has permission can retrieve this password, but the demo code would be a little more complex. WDYT?

Ok, so since the end user needs to get this password, this should either:
- removed sensitive  = true so that the output will display the actual password
- go down the path suggested by longunmanb to save password to KeyVault

My $.02 would be to remove the sensitive = true since adding kv would add much more complication to this example.

191.title: Fix concurrent error in cosmosdb example
191.body:
According to the [document](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cosmos-db/how-to-manage-database-account#create-an-account), the CosmosDB account name must be unique:

>Enter a name to identify your Azure Cosmos DB account. Because documents.azure.com is appended to the name that you provide to create your URI, use a unique name. The name can contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and the hyphen (-) character. It must be 3-44 characters.

This pr tried to make account name global unique during the test.
191.Author: lonegunmanb

Commits.commit_message: fix concurrent error in cosmosdb example
change to random_string to reduce the collision rate

File_Comments.comment: If you are going to do this string manipulation, you need to make sure to have validation in the variable to ensure that things don't go sideways when someone enters a string that cannot be split this way.
same as above.
Thanks, @grayzu. I've fixed it.

Issue_Comments.comment_body:
> Since the expected values are known, I think we should be more specific in the validation.

@grayzu @lonegunmanb 

My concern is having information in multiple places. 

With hard-coded values, someone now has to know to update this file every time the storage team updates the options. 

I would suggest either:
- Leave it as-is (where we assume the reader will search for the values if they need them)
- Put in the description the URL of the [valid Azure storage SKU options](https://learn.microsoft.com/rest/api/storagerp/srp_sku_types).

IMHO: Since this is an example and will be included in documentation, we should be showing "best practices" and encouraging catching issues earlier in the process rather than pushing them out to be caught by the API does not align with this.
@grayzu I made the requested changes.

203.title: User Story 60501: 101-key-vault-key
203.body: Part of POC to test generating sample code and articles using OpenAI.
203.Author: TomArcherMsft

Commits.commit_message: New sample (converted from Bicep via OpenAI)
Added usage of vars to code.

File_Comments.comment:
We'll have a testing issue here. The `data.azurerm_client_config.current` only works for service principal, but in our e2e test environment we're using managed identity, the `data.azurerm_client_config.current.object_id` could be empty string in e2e test.

Now in our e2e test we'll setup an environment variable named [`TF_VAR_msi_id`](https://github.com/Azure/terraform/blob/master/test/e2e/quickstart_test.go#L14-L18), that means if you've added a variable named `msi_id` like this way, during the test it would be assigned the identity id that we're using for the test:

```hcl
variable "msi_id" {
  type     = string
  default = null
}
```

I would recommend a `local` expression like this:

```hcl
locals {
  current_user_id = coalesce(var.msi_id, data.azurerm_client_config.current.object_id)
}
```

Then change line 30 to:

```hcl
object_id = local.current_user_id
```

Could we simplify it to?:

```hcl
name = coalesce(var.key_name, "key-${random_string.azurerm_key_vault_key_name.result}")
```

Could we simplify it to?:

```hcl
name = coalesce(var.vault_name, "vault-${random_string.azurerm_key_vault_name.result}")
```
@lonegunmanb The coalesce fcn is new to me. Thanks!
@lonegunmanb @grayzu Please also check my description for this var. Thanks!
Looks like this is duplicated in main.tf and variables. tf. please remove one. I believe locals should live in the file where it is used so I'd recommend removing from variables file.
Thanks! I meant to move it to main, but copied it instead.

This would be cleaner to do this with a random_pet resource:
```terraform
resource "random_pet" "this" {
   prefix        = "sql"

}

File_Comments.comment: We should set the count of this to 0 if the workspace_name variable is set.
Why is this the only resource with tags. If no reason, we should either remove for all or take tags as variable and use it in all resources that support it.
By convention, ```depends_on``` should be positioned at the bottom/last of the properties and should have a space above.
Same comment as workspace_name: should be set to 0 if variable defined.
0 if variable defined.
Should be last property.
I'll ask the contributors.
They said we could remove the tag.

We can remove this explicitly `depends_on` since we've referred `azurerm_databricks_workspace.databricks` at line 90, now `azurerm_key_vault_access_policy.databricks` depens on `azurerm_databricks_workspace.databricks` implicitly already.

We've encounter an e2e test error because the current Terraform configuration is not idempotent. After apply the config, then run `terraform plan` we'll see an update in the generated plan. The change was caused by the mix of using nested `access_policy` block along with separated `azurerm_key_vault_access_policy` resource. We should use either nested block or separated resource, but not both. I would recommend the separated resource because if our users wrap this example into their own reusable module, a separated resource would allow them to declare extra access policies outside their module.

I would recommend removing this nested block and add a new resource:

```hcl
resource "azurerm_key_vault_access_policy" "current_user" {
  key_vault_id = azurerm_key_vault.vault.id
  tenant_id = data.azurerm_client_config.current.tenant_id
  object_id = local.current_user_id

  key_permissions    = var.key_permissions
  secret_permissions = var.secret_permissions
}
```

Since we've converted the nested access policy block into separated resource, we might need an extra `depends_on` here:

```hcl
depends_on = [azurerm_key_vault_access_policy.current_user]
```

[List items should be accessed using square brackets](https://github.com/terraform-linters/tflint-ruleset-terraform/blob/main/docs/rules/terraform_deprecated_index.md).

```hcl
tenant_id    = azurerm_databricks_workspace.databricks.storage_account_identity[0].tenant_id
```

[List items should be accessed using square brackets](https://github.com/terraform-linters/tflint-ruleset-terraform/blob/main/docs/rules/terraform_deprecated_index.md).

```hcl
object_id    = azurerm_databricks_workspace.databricks.storage_account_identity[0].principal_id
```

In line 72:

```hcl
resource "azurerm_key_vault_key" "key" {
  name         = coalesce(var.key_name, random_pet.azurerm_key_vault_key_name[0].id)
```

So when `var.key_name` equals to empty string(`""`) it would lead to `random_pet.azurerm_key_vault_key_name[0]`, but `random_pet.azurerm_key_vault_key_name` would be created only when `var.key_name` is `null`.

We can use the following toggle expression:

```hcl
count = var.key_name == null || var.key_name == "" ? 1 : 0
```
Since `azurerm_key_vault_key.key` should not declare `count`, we'd better revert this line back to `key_vault_key_id = azurerm_key_vault_key.key.id`.
Apology for the confusion here, what I mean is adding a toggle count `count        = var.key_name == null || var.key_name == "" ? 1 : 0` to `random_pet.azurerm_key_vault_key_name` resource.

1442936994.comment_body:
Hi @TomArcherMsft thanks for the update, we still got one issue here.

```hcl
resource "azurerm_key_vault_key" "key" {
  name         = coalesce(var.key_name, random_pet.azurerm_key_vault_key_name[0].id)
```

>[`coalesce`](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/functions/coalesce) takes any number of arguments and returns the first one that **isn't null or an empty string**.

So if `var.key_name` is set to `""`, `coalesce` would return `random_pet.azurerm_key_vault_key_name[0].id`. But `random_pet.azurerm_key_vault_key_name`'s declaration is:

```hcl
resource "random_pet" "azurerm_key_vault_key_name" {
  count  = var.key_name == null ? 1 : 0
```

`var.key_name = ""` would lead to `0`, that would cause an error. So we should change it to:

```hcl
resource "random_pet" "azurerm_key_vault_key_name" {
  count  = var.key_name == null || var.key_name == "" ? 1 : 0
```

  name         = coalesce(var.key_name, random_pet.azurerm_key_vault_key_name[0].id)
```

>[`coalesce`](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/functions/coalesce) takes any number of arguments and returns the first one that **isn't null or an empty string**.

So if `var.key_name` is set to `""`, `coalesce` would return `random_pet.azurerm_key_vault_key_name[0].id`. But `random_pet.azurerm_key_vault_key_name`'s declaration is:

```hcl
resource "random_pet" "azurerm_key_vault_key_name" {
  count  = var.key_name == null ? 1 : 0
```

`var.key_name = ""` would lead to `0`, that would cause an error. So we should change it to:

```hcl
resource "random_pet" "azurerm_key_vault_key_name" {
  count  = var.key_name == null || var.key_name == "" ? 1 : 0
```

Issue_Comments.comment_body:
@mbender-ms 

- Please don't include the MD file in the code-sample repo. Once the code is merged, I'll generate the article via an app I wrote that uses OpenAI.
- Resource names should be produced from the `random_pet` resource instead of relying on the customer to supply a valid value in a variable. 
- Why are you using the tag attribute when it doesn't seem to add anything to the sample?
- All resources and vars should also be listed in the README file
- The README file points to the wrong article in the **Example** section. 
- The outputs.tf file needs to display any randomly generated value as well as any values that are necessary for the customer to work with the newly created resources. For example, the **Verify the results** section should show the AzCLI and AzPS command necessary to show what was created in the article. To that end, the sample needs to output any necessary arguments to those command calls.
- See the following sample for how to define the providers' version constraints: https://github.com/Azure/terraform/blob/master/quickstart/101-key-vault-key/providers.tf
- All variables need to have a type, description, and default.
- All variables need to be snake case (this sample is using camel casing).
- By convention, the `depends_on` meta-argument should be the last line of any resource and be preceded by a blank line.

1447106252.comment_body:
Another thought, we can replace hardcoded member resources by using `count` like this:

```hcl
resource "azurerm_virtual_network" "vnet" {
  count = 3

  name                = "${random_pet.virtual_network_name.id}-0${count.index}"
  resource_group_name = azurerm_resource_group.rg.name
  location            = azurerm_resource_group.rg.location
  address_space       = ["10.${count.index}.0.0/16"]
}

# Add a subnet to each virtual network

resource "azurerm_subnet" "subnet_vnet" {
  count = 3

  name                 = "default"
  virtual_network_name = azurerm_virtual_network.vnet[count.index].name
  resource_group_name  = azurerm_resource_group.rg.name
  address_prefixes     = ["10.${count.index}.0.0/24"]
}

resource "azurerm_network_manager_static_member" "static_members" {
  count = 3
  
  name                      = "static-member-0${count.index}"
  network_group_id          = azurerm_network_manager_network_group.network_group.id
  target_virtual_network_id = azurerm_virtual_network.vnet[count.index].id
}
```

1447106252.comment_body:
Another thought, we can replace hardcoded member resources by using `count` like this:

```hcl
resource "azurerm_virtual_network" "vnet" {
  count = 3

  name                = "${random_pet.virtual_network_name.id}-0${count.index}"
  resource_group_name = azurerm_resource_group.rg.name
  location            = azurerm_resource_group.rg.location
  address_space       = ["10.${count.index}.0.0/16"]
}

# Add a subnet to each virtual network

resource "azurerm_subnet" "subnet_vnet" {
  count = 3

  name                 = "default"
  virtual_network_name = azurerm_virtual_network.vnet[count.index].name
  resource_group_name  = azurerm_resource_group.rg.name
  address_prefixes     = ["10.${count.index}.0.0/24"]
}

resource "azurerm_network_manager_static_member" "static_members" {
  count = 3
  
  name                      = "static-member-0${count.index}"
  network_group_id          = azurerm_network_manager_network_group.network_group.id
  target_virtual_network_id = azurerm_virtual_network.vnet[count.index].id
}
```

File_Comments.comment: Since we have set [default value](https://github.com/Azure/terraform/pull/238/files#diff-effdf19b131d91c87ba12e37d2e50eb8382e761eb9013c4aed10778debdfe6d6R17) for `var.username` already I think we can skip `coalesce` here and use `var.username` directly.
Same issue here.

Using the coalesce() function allows us to give the reader two options: variable or random. If the reader blanks out the var, they get a random value - such as if they're testing the code by running it multiple times and can't use the same value twice.

Using the coalesce() function allows us to give the reader two options: variable or random. If the reader blanks out the var, they get a random value - such as if they're testing the code by running it multiple times and can't use the same value twice.

I understand that you'd like to set a default value for `admin_username` when `var.username` is absent, but things would go differently than you thought.

>Using the coalesce() function allows us to give the reader two options: variable or random. If the reader blanks out the var, they get a random value

I didn't see any random factors in this case. According to the [document](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/functions/coalesce):

>`coalesce` takes any number of arguments and returns the first one that isn't null or an empty string.

So when `var.username` is `null` or empty string, `coalesce` function would return `azureuser` as default value.

```hcl
variable "username" {
  type        = string
  description = "The username for the local account that will be created on the new VM."
  default     = "azureadmin"
}
```

If the module's caller omits `var.username`, then `var.username`'s value would be `azureadmin`.

```hcl
admin_username                  = coalesce(var.username, "azureuser")
```

So when the caller omits `var.username`, `admin_username` would be `azureadmin`, not `azureuser`.

Btw this is also the reason I suggested a `nullable = false` for `var.username`, if we do so, when user set `var.username` to `null` on purpose, the `var.username`'s value would still be `azureadmin`.

```hcl
variable "username" {
  type        = string
  description = "The username for the local account that will be created on the new VM."
  default     = "azureadmin"
}
```

If the module's caller omits `var.username`, then `var.username`'s value would be `azureadmin`.

```hcl
admin_username                  = coalesce(var.username, "azureuser")
```

So when the caller omits `var.username`, `admin_username` would be `azureadmin`, not `azureuser`.

File_Comments.comment: Why is this lifecycle required to ignore changes?
I think I see why that was added. We should add a comment that explains why this lifecycle ignore changes is required for this scenario.

@grayzu @lonegunmanb 

From my understanding of a [GitHub Issue on this topic](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/issues/10009), since this sample is creating an Application Gateway, which is later managed by an Ingress Controller, there is no need to create a backend address pool (BEP). However, the BEP is still required by the resource. Therefore, "lifecycle:ignore_changes" is used to prevent TF from managing the gateway.
I found that we need to add `url_path_map,` here.
We can add a comment here: `Since the gateway is controlled by Application Gateway Ingress Controller, the K8s controller would setup gateway's config so we just ignore them in Terraform config.`
Please add a comment above the lifecycle block to clarify why it is needed. With this addition, I am good with this PR.
@grayzu I added the requested comment.

I prefer do give users the latest versions this was tested on so they dont run into any issues but happy to make the change.

since this is quickstart its mainly used for testing so if they want to destroy and tear it down this will delete everything. I have run into issues in the past where some resources is hanging around and doesnt delete the resource group so this at least forces it all to be removed and customers dont have resources hanging around.
can remove if needed.

> I prefer do give users the latest versions this was tested on so they dont run into any issues but happy to make the change.

@cshea15 Once integrated into the system, each sample is automatically tested with each release of Terraform and the Terraform Azure provider (generally weekly). This is how we catch breaking changes so that we can update the code and article without relying on customers to tell us of broken articles.

You're using a pattern where you're specifying a flag at the RG level to delete everything in the RG should the encompassed entity not automatically delete. However, many times, a lower-level entity has its own flag for this purpose. For example, let's say you have a VM with a disk. instead of using `prevent_deletion_if_contains_resources` at the RG level, you can use `delete_data_disks_on_termination` at the VM level, which deletes the disk when the VM is deleted. The Terraform PG prefers this latter pattern.
got it thanks Tom, i updated it with the virtual machine feature.
got it updated to the suggested versioning.

247.title: Convert legacy Packer json template to hcl2 template
247.body:
WARNING!

To merag this pr, the corresponding document also must be updated, or document's CI pipeline would be broke.

We also need to update the [document](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/developer/terraform/create-vm-scaleset-network-disks-using-packer-hcl#create-an-azure-image-by-using-packer). In the current document we hard coded the credential in packer's config file (though this credential is fake), this practice might be misunderstood as a recommended way to set the credential, which is not.

We'd better modify the document by using [Packer var file](https://developer.hashicorp.com/packer/guides/hcl/variables#from-a-file) to set the credential and warn our reader not to commit this var file into VCS. Why a var file is better than the command line flag or environment variables for our reader? Because setting a var file would not leave traceable logs in our reader's shell history.  

This example includes a Packer config file so the reader could build a virtual machine image that used by the Terraform code. This pr added a testing harness setup step so we can build the vm image in our e2e test, then apply the example code.

@TomArcherMsft @grayzu WDYT?
247.Author: lonegunmanb

Commits.commit_message: convert legacy Packer json template to hcl2 template
try to add a testing harness setup for vmss-packer-jumpbox example so we can run auto test for it
try to remove duplicates from changed folder list
try to remove duplicates from changed folder list
rename test_harness sub-folder to packer_image_resource_group so the readers could know what's it for
add back ubuntu.json so we won't break CI pipeline

Please use validation.

Currently, the settings of random_string would generate a values starts with number but azurerm_machine_learning_compute_instance doesn't allow it. So I updated the settings of random_string for azurerm_machine_learning_compute_instance.

298.title: virtual network manager - New Terraform Template - Quickstart Create virtual network manager with Management Group Scope
298.Author: mbender-ms

File_Comments.comment: Would you please change the name to `"101-vnmcmgs-${random_pet.rg_name.id}"? Sometimes I found some legacy resources in our testing environment, and I have no clue which tests caused these pending resources, a name with such prefix could help me a lot, thanks!
Done.

Issue_Comments.comment_body:
> @TomArcherMsft I re-using what was in the current template. I did not re-create this from scratch based off of the templates recommended in the updated guide.

 As I recall, those values were specified to me by someone on the terraform team during the creatin process of the original. I did 
> I've updated to use the following:

version = "~> 3.56.0, < 4.0"

> @mbender-ms
> 
> If you're going to explicitly state a min & max, then you don't need the pessimistic operator. Personally, I'd use "~>3.56" (without the max), which states min=3.56 and max is anything less than 4.
> 
> However, the way you have it now (and had it before) both function. Therefore, for me, this is not a blocking issue.
> 
> @lonegunmanb @stemaMSFT I believe that @grayzu is OOF for Thanksgiving. Could one of you merge this PR?

Sure. Yesterday this e2e test failed because we don't have `az` cli in our testing container, so I upgraded the container image. I'll rerun the test now @TomArcherMsft @mbender-ms .

We've got the following error:

```text
│ Error running command '         az provider register --namespace
        	            	│ 'Microsoft.Network' -m 5ef28019-2c13-43a9-83dc-b4568723ec6c
        	            	│ ': exit status 1. Output: ERROR: Please run 'az login' to setup account.
        	            	│ 
        	            	╵}
```

I'll see what we can do to fix this issue.
@lonegunmanb It looks like pre-check is now failing. Any ideas?

> @lonegunmanb It looks like pre-check is now failing. Any ideas?

Hi @mbender-ms it looks like your branch is outdated, would you please rebase your branch with the latest master branch and try again? Thanks!
#please-close
#please-open
@TomArcherMsft @lonegunmanb Anything I'm missing to get this rolling? My branch is updated. Looks like there is still a change request but that has been completed. Thanks!
@mbender-ms looks like the prepr-check is failing, if you could get that resolved I can kick off tests again.
@stemaMSFT Looks like I was missing some quotes. Fixed that so let's try again!
@mbender-ms the e2e tests failed here, take a look with Tom if needed and resolve and we can re-kick off the tests

> @mbender-ms the e2e tests failed here, take a look with Tom if needed and resolve and we can re-kick off the tests

Unfortunately, I know nothing about management groups. If Michael doesn't know, maybe @lonegunmanb can help.

Hi @mbender-ms @TomArcherMsft , I want explain this testing error and my solution step by step here, so we can fix this issue and get this pr merged.

## The testing error

```text
╷
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: │ Error: local-exec provisioner error
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: │ 
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: │   with null_resource.register_rp_to_mg,
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: │   on main.tf line 61, in resource "null_resource" "register_rp_to_mg":
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: │   61:   provisioner "local-exec" {
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: │ 
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: │ Error running command '         az provider register --namespace
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: │ 'Microsoft.Network' -m 43b729bc-8452-44b2-a53a-fb3de05bee86
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: │ ': exit status 1. Output: ERROR: Please run 'az login' to setup account.
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: │ 
Test_Quickstarts/quickstart/101-virtual-network-manager-create-management-group-scope 2023-11-30T00:18:34Z command.go:185: ╵
```

Root cause: `Please run 'az login' to setup account.`

Because we use `az` cli in`null_resource`'s `provisioner`, this error complained that we must execute `az login` first.

## How can we `az login` in e2e test?

I've tried to fix this pr and I've passed the test, my branch is: https://github.com/lonegunmanb/azterraform/tree/fix-vnet-manager-group, you can check my attempt pr at #300 . In this pr you'll see `This branch was successfully deployed`, which means it passed the test.

I just rebased Michael's branch with the latest `master` branch, and all my fixes are in this commit: https://github.com/lonegunmanb/azterraform/commit/b18220ba498bbea2b51478dbdd49567de27df90e

I've created a special sub-test method for this example since it requires `az login` as testing setup: https://github.com/lonegunmanb/azterraform/commit/b18220ba498bbea2b51478dbdd49567de27df90e#diff-7e867c4be98de0c4deb27c03c13de85fc7383a011fcb50a9058232dedfde2b64R146-R175 , I executed `az login` with required flags before the test, and `az logout` after the test. I also added a `discardWriter` type to discard all stdout from `az login` to avoid potential secret leaks.

## How to reuse my code

You can pull the branch from my repo, I have rebased it with the latest `master` branch, you can just force push to your branch, then try again. Please feel free to contact me if you have any further questions @mbender-ms .

@lonegunmanb Thanks for your help on this.

I'm currently unable to follow your steps to pull your repo into my branch. I'm nuking my local and going to see if that fixes things. I'll keep you posted.
@lonegunmanb Force pushed your changes into my branch. Please let me know if this fixes it and lets PR pass.
@mbender-ms thanks to your efforts, this PR is merged!

1735849840.comment_body: Thanks @mbender-ms for opening this pr! Some comments.

I've tried to fix this pr and I've passed the test, my branch is: https://github.com/lonegunmanb/azterraform/tree/fix-vnet-manager-group, you can check my attempt pr at #300 . In this pr you'll see `This branch was successfully deployed`, which means it passed the test.

I just rebased Michael's branch with the latest `master` branch, and all my fixes are in this commit: https://github.com/lonegunmanb/azterraform/commit/b18220ba498bbea2b51478dbdd49567de27df90e

I've created a special sub-test method for this example since it requires `az login` as testing setup: https://github.com/lonegunmanb/azterraform/commit/b18220ba498bbea2b51478dbdd49567de27df90e#diff-7e867c4be98de0c4deb27c03c13de85fc7383a011fcb50a9058232dedfde2b64R146-R175 , I executed `az login` with required flags before the test, and `az logout` after the test. I also added a `discardWriter` type to discard all stdout from `az login` to avoid potential secret leaks.

## How to reuse my code

You can pull the branch from my repo, I have rebased it with the latest `master` branch, you can just force push to your branch, then try again. Please feel free to contact me if you have any further questions @mbender-ms .

@lonegunmanb Thanks for your help on this.

I'm currently unable to follow your steps to pull your repo into my branch. I'm nuking my local and going to see if that fixes things. I'll keep you posted.
@lonegunmanb Force pushed your changes into my branch. Please let me know if this fixes it and lets PR pass.
@mbender-ms thanks to your efforts, this PR is merged!

File_Comments.comment: The value seems like nat gateway's id to me, could we rename this output and modify the description?
I left that in there because we want the NAT gateway output

This output's name is `nat_gateway`, which implies that the value should be `azurerm_nat_gateway.my_nat_gateway`, but the description is `The name of the created NAT gateway`, which implies that the value should be `azurerm_nat_gateway.my_nat_gateway.name`, then we have `azurerm_nat_gateway.my_nat_gateway.id` as the `value`. which one do you want as the output? Could we improve the name because I think it might confuse the reader? WDYT @asudbring?

Ahh I understand now.  Thank you for clarifying.  Will review and change and make consistent/clear.
Thanks!

I changed it so it is the name that outputs and changed the value to match.  Should clear it up. Ready for workflow kick off.

314.title: New Sample for iothub with private link
314.body: This PR adds a new quickstart sample for deploying iothub with device provisioning service behind a virtual network
314.Author: abeebu

Commits.commit_message: Add sample for iothub with private link
Add dns record for built in endpoint

Issue_Comments.comment_body: @lonegunmanb Would you be able to review this PR please?

> @lonegunmanb Would you be able to review this PR please?

Hi @abeebu thanks for opening this pr! Overall it LGTM but I found that you've created a private dns zone for event hub, but no resource for event hub, no `azurerm_eventhub`, no private endpoint or private link for eventhub. Is that correct?

> > @lonegunmanb Would you be able to review this PR please?
> 
> Hi @abeebu thanks for opening this pr! Overall it LGTM but I found that you've created a private dns zone for event hub, but no resource for event hub, no `azurerm_eventhub`, no private endpoint or private link for eventhub. Is that correct?

@lonegunmanb yes, this configuration utilizes the built-in eventhub endpoint for iothub. So we(the customer) does not need to deploy a separate eventhub resource. However to ensure private connectivity between the iothub and its builtin endpoint, we need to add the private dns zone and create a dns record for its IP.

See [here](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support#built-in-event-hubs-compatible-endpoint) for more details on the builtin endpoint.

In a follow up PR later this month, I will also show the configuration for deploying the iothub together with a separate storage resource and eventhub resource for message routing all behind a VNET.
Just a nudge that this PR is awaiting your action @lonegunmanb 😁
Tagging you @stemaMSFT and @TomArcherMsft 🙂

@abeebu Thanks much for the contribution.

If you haven't done so already, please read the Contributor Guide article, "[Publish a Terraform Quickstart](https://review.learn.microsoft.com/en-us/help/contribute/global-terraform-template?branch=main#create-and-publish-the-terraform-sample)".

1. **[main.tf]** Please utilize the pattern required by the PG for the rg name. You can look at the [following code](https://github.com/Azure/terraform/blob/master/quickstart/101-resource-group/main.tf) for an example.
2. **[providers.tf]** You currently have a provider version constraint of: `>= 3.35.0, < 4.0.0`. I'm assuming you're specifying 3.35 and above but less than 4.0. Is that correct? If so, the canonical way to write that is `~> 3.351`. The [pessimistic constraint operator](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/expressions/version-constraints) (the tilde) basically tells Terraform that you want the latest version but only incrementing the right-most version component.
3. **[variables.tf]** Use the pattern for declaring the rg vars as used in the following example: [variables.tf](https://github.com/Azure/terraform/blob/master/quickstart/101-resource-group/variables.tf)
4. **[readme.md]** Use the table format as in https://github.com/Azure/terraform/blob/master/quickstart/101-resource-group/variables.tf
5. **[readme.md]** The first two rows of the table should be the rg prefix and rg location as in https://github.com/Azure/terraform/blob/master/quickstart/101-resource-group/variables.tf
6. @grayzu This PR has both a main.tf and a network.tf. Are you ok with that, or should everything go into main.tf?
7. @abeebu What is the Azure CLI command to display the main resource created with this sample? Are all the params required by the Azure CLI command in the outputs.tf file?
8. @lonegunmanb Could you please review when time permits? I've put it on the kanban board. Thanks!
Apology for the late reply @abeebu & @TomArcherMsft , LGTM!

Thanks! I just confirmed that in the `data.azurerm_storage_account_sas.example.sas`, it has a prefix "?" . So I think we don't need a delimiter after ${azurerm_storage_container.example.name}
